title: Scottish Renewables names new chair, celebrates country's 'renewable powerhouse' potential
lead: Scottish Renewables has appointed Adam Morrison as its new chair, replacing the outgoing Rob Forrest, who has chaired the organisation since 2018.
author: Alice Grundy

title: SPEN secures 140MW of flexibility in latest tender
lead: ​SP Energy Networks (SPEN) has procured 140MW of flexibility contracts in its latest tender, the first in which it has tendered for low voltage flexibility.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Power prices dip down to low of -£61/MWh as winds batter Britain
lead: The windy weather pushed power prices down below zero last week, hitting a low of -£61/MWh according to EnAppSys.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Hubject and ev.energy announce partnership to simplify EV charging
lead: ​Electric vehicle (EV) software companies Hubject and ev.energy have signed a partnership to help simplify home and public charging.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Marubeni teams up with Origami and Virta for V2G proof of concept
lead: ​A new proof of concept for vehicle-to-grid (V2G) and vehicle-to-building (V2B) is being launched by Marubeni alongside Origami Energy, Grid Edge, Smartest Energy and Virta.
author: Alice Grundy

title: The solution to the problem of tight margins? Flexibility for all
lead: The high prices seen in recent capacity market auctions are symptomatic of underlying issues in the grid, and there is an urgent need to make flexibility available to all according to Dan Connor, Optimisation and Battery Sales manager at Centrica Business Solutions.
author: Dan Connor

title: Motor Fuel Group unveils £400m investment into ultra-rapid EV charging
lead: ​The Motor Fuel Group (MFG) is to install c.3,000 150kW and 350kW electric vehicle (EV) chargers at its forecourts by the end of 2030 in a new commitment to electrification.
author: Alice Grundy

title: DCC proposes creation of ‘game changer’ free-to-access data exchanges
lead: ​The Data Communications Company (DCC) is suggesting that the creation of free-to-access data exchanges could support the move to net zero.
author: Alice Grundy

title: PODCAST: Green grids under extreme weather pressure and more expensive solar
lead: The new episode of the Solar Media Podcast, sponsored by Honeywell, is now available stream, as we take stock of the lessons renewables and power grids can learn from recent winter storms in Texas.
author: Current± Staff

title: Texas and the storm: Could an extreme weather event cause a similar blackout in the UK?
lead: As people look for lessons to be learnt from the Texas blackouts in February, Current± asked if an extreme weather event could ever lead to rolling blackouts in the UK.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Centrica unveils ‘virtual fuel card’ to tackle fleet electrification barriers
lead: ​Centrica is launching a Fleet Charging Management System which acts as a virtual fuel card, allowing drivers to plug into any standard electric vehicle (EV) charger.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Bulb's losses narrow as its customer base continues to surge
lead: ​Bulb’s revenues are up 85%, helping to reduce its operating losses to £59 million as its customer base surges.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: GRIDSERVE to spruce up Ecotricity's Electric Highway with new chargers as it takes 25% stake
lead: ​GRIDSERVE has taken a 25% stake in Ecotricity's Electric Highway network of electric vehicle (EV) chargers, with plans to replace the current infrastructure.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Supplier start-up Rebel Energy hits crowdfunding target as it looks to summer launch
lead: ​Rebel Energy has raised 157% of its crowdfunding target in just seven days, with more than £220,000 raised.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Battery capacity more than doubles in T-4 auction but gas still dominates
lead: ​The T-4 Capacity Market auctioned closed yesterday in its twelfth round, with 40819.895MW awarded agreements.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Ofgem to lower shareholder returns and direct investment to greening local networks
lead: ​Ofgem is to significantly lower the proportion of money going to network company shareholders in the next price period as it looks to target more flexible local grids.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: ​BP Pulse sets aside £2 million to improve UK’s legacy charging infrastructure
lead: BP Pulse is making £2 million available to deliver what it has described as “radical improvement” in the reliability of older UK electric vehicle (EV) charging infrastructure.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Commercial EV charging equipment market to soar to over $870bn by 2050 - WoodMac
lead: ​New analysis from Wood Mackenzie has found that by 2050 the commercial electric vehicle (EV) charging equipment market will be worth over $870 billion (£623 billion).
author: Alice Grundy

title: Shell partners EV charging subscription service Onto
lead: ​Shell has partnered electric vehicle (EV) charging subscription provider Onto, offering users access to over 3,400 UK chargepoints.
author: Alice Grundy

title: T-4 Capacity Market clears in round 12 at £20 - £15/kW/year
lead: ​The T-4 Capacity Market auction has cleared in its 12th round today, with a price between £20 - £15/kW/year.
author: Molly Lempriere
